name: Silver Sunset
description: 14 x 11 inches, acrylic painting on canvas panel.  I love to paint mountains and water of all kinds.  I believe they pull the viewer into the scene to relax them and makes those daily stressors and worries kind of melt away.  This picture combines both to create a unique sense of serenity.

name: Corncrib Barn 3A
description: This 3 1/2 by 5 1/2 inch oval pen and ink original was done on art paper, mounted on glass and includes a black scrolled metal frame.  It pictures the old Missouri style corncrib where farmers kept the eared corn to feed their pigs and other live stock.  I remember playing in one of these a many a day in my youth.

name: Dragon Fly on Daisys
description: This 8 x 10 inch oval was initially scroll sawed from 1/8 inch birch plywood and then backed by genuine stained glass to make an original, one-of-a-kind art piece.  The wood is finished in dark walnut stain.

name: Kokopelli Moon
description: 8 x10 inch artwork scroll sawed out of 1/4 inch birch plywood.  It is finished with dark walnut stain.

name: Original Wolf Pup
description:
This one of a kind depiction of a wolf pup portrait was inspired by a recent trip I took when I saw this pup crossing the road with it's mother in tow.

It is 16 x 20 inches and was pyrographed onto bontex which is a leather industry product.  Pyrography, also known commonly as wood burning when done on wood, is the art of making an immage by burning it into your material.  It takes patience and a good sense of what you are trying to produce since you must frequently turn your workpiece to get proper burning thus losing perspective very easily.

The Frame is not included, however, ask at time of purchase if you want a custom frame.  I am a framer also.  Otherwise you can purchase a suitable frame just about anywhere. 

View my total collection of pyrographs, acrylic paintings, pen and ink drawings, and scroll saw creations at www.dewaynewilliams.etsy.com
